title: Compiletest segfaults on Windows (MSYS2) due to some string formatting issues
body:
Happens on the current Rust master (b9a93fad92a3411a0e452e339af06703e31c1464) with freshly updated MSYS2 packages.

Way to reproduce:

```
make check-stage1-rpass
```

`gdb` output

```
Thread 279 received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
[Switching to Thread 1056.0x13c]
0x000000006def4ac0 in fmt::Write::write_fmt::Adapter$LT$$u27$a$C$$u20$T$GT$.Write::write_str::h7588194824453486976 ()
   from C:\msys64\home\we\rust\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\stage1\bin\std-9026086f.dll
(gdb) bt
#0  0x000000006def4ac0 in fmt::Write::write_fmt::Adapter$LT$$u27$a$C$$u20$T$GT$.Write::write_str::h7588194824453486976 ()
   from C:\msys64\home\we\rust\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\stage1\bin\std-9026086f.dll
#1  0x000000006df3f063 in fmt::write::hc0b53eec4d9a5e50sAW ()
   from C:\msys64\home\we\rust\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\stage1\bin\std-9026086f.dll
#2  0x000000006dec6c1c in sys_common::unwind::begin_unwind_fmt::h91b691f30a1273b8YXt ()
   from C:\msys64\home\we\rust\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\stage1\bin\std-9026086f.dll
#3  0x000000006def4a73 in rust_begin_unwind ()
   from C:\msys64\home\we\rust\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\stage1\bin\std-9026086f.dll
#4  0x000000006df17929 in panicking::panic_fmt::h9289505c6075ed65fLL ()
   from C:\msys64\home\we\rust\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\stage1\bin\std-9026086f.dll
#5  0x0000000000416a4f in result::unwrap_failed::h8016291200450874397 ()
#6  0x00000000004161f0 in procsrv::run::hff07197822f7da739ba ()
#7  0x000000000042d7c4 in runtest::compose_and_run::he8c3eac34dc9c102yJc ()
#8  0x00000000004294b8 in runtest::exec_compiled_test::h9d91a2bbaa51931cXCc ()
#9  0x000000000042985e in runtest::run_rpass_test_revision::hc39d38e4afba1259Sbb ()
#10 0x000000000041d7de in runtest::run_rpass_test::h835402f6446fb802wbb ()
#11 0x000000000040e853 in runtest::run::ha22317b217fe81e35Wa ()
#12 0x000000000041435d in boxed::F.FnBox$LT$A$GT$::call_box::h14820138337126314305 ()
#13 0x000000006a2235f4 in sys_common::unwind::try::try_fn::h12278403829978334973 ()
   from C:\msys64\home\we\rust\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\stage1\bin\test-9026086f.dll
#14 0x000000006def499b in sys_common::unwind::inner_try::hd46991784c8d2dddUVt
    ()
   from C:\msys64\home\we\rust\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\stage1\bin\std-9026086f.dll
#15 0x000000006a2239ab in boxed::F.FnBox$LT$A$GT$::call_box::h6711279820647761121 ()
   from C:\msys64\home\we\rust\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\stage1\bin\test-9026086f.dll
#16 0x000000006deffa9a in sys::thread::Thread::new::thread_start::hb954eea791cc0c9c6Gz ()
   from C:\msys64\home\we\rust\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\stage1\bin\std-9026086f.dll
#17 0x00007ffcd5ac13d2 in KERNEL32!BaseThreadInitThunk ()
   from C:\Windows\system32\kernel32.dll
#18 0x00007ffcd61c54e4 in ntdll!RtlUserThreadStart ()
   from C:\Windows\SYSTEM32\ntdll.dll
#19 0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()
```

There are some other tests failing without segfault for the same reasons, for example `run-pass\bare-fn-implements-fn-mut.rs`
Test output (note the corrupted strings in the test stderr and test paths).
The same code works successfully when compiled and run without compiletest.

```
$ make check-stage1-rpass TESTNAME=bare-fn-implements-fn-mut
cfg: version 1.9.0-dev (b9a93fad9 2016-03-18)
cfg: build triple x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
cfg: host triples x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
cfg: target triples x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
cfg: host for x86_64-pc-windows-gnu is x86_64
cfg: os for x86_64-pc-windows-gnu is pc-windows-gnu
cfg: no good valgrind for x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
cfg: using CC=gcc (CFG_CC)
cfg: disabling valgrind run-pass tests
cfg: including test rules
cfg: lexer tooling not available, skipping lexer test...
run rpass [x86_64-pc-windows-gnu]: x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/stage1/bin/compiletest.exe

running 1 test
test [run-pass] ▒run-pass\bare-fn-implements-fn-mut.rs ... FAILED

failures:

---- [run-pass] ▒run-pass\bare-fn-implements-fn-mut.rs stdout ----

error: test run failed!
status: exit code: 101
command: PATH="x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/stage1/lib/rustlib/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/lib;C:\msys64\home\we\rust\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\stage1\bin;C:\msys64\home\we\rust\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\llvm\Release\lib;C:\msys64\mingw64\bin;C:\msys64\usr\local\bin;C:\msys64\usr\bin;C:\msys64\usr\bin;C:\Windows\system32;C:\Windows;C:\Windows\System32\Wbem;C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0;C:\ProgramData\chocolatey\bin;C:\Program Files (x86)\NVIDIA Corporation\PhysX\Common;C:\Program Files\OpenVPN\bin;C:\Program Files (x86)\Skype\Phone" x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/test/run-pass\bare-fn-implements-fn-mut.stage1-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu.exe
stdout:
------------------------------------------
hello

------------------------------------------
stderr:
------------------------------------------
thread '<main>' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)` (left: `"\u{226}oo\u{222}ar"`, right: `"foobar"`)', C:/msys64/home/we/rust/src/test/run-pass/bare-fn-implements-fn-mut.rs:35
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.

------------------------------------------

thread '[run-pass] �run-pass\bare-fn-implements-fn-mut.rs' panicked at 'explicit panic', C:/msys64/home/we/rust/src/compiletest\runtest.rs:1667
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.


failures:
    [run-pass] ▒run-pass\bare-fn-implements-fn-mut.rs

test result: FAILED. 0 passed; 1 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured

thread '<main>' panicked at 'Some tests failed', C:/msys64/home/we/rust/src/compiletest/compiletest.rs:242
/home/we/rust/mk/tests.mk:748: recipe for target 'tmp/check-stage1-T-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu-H-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu-rpass.ok' failed
make: *** [tmp/check-stage1-T-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu-H-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu-rpass.ok] Error 101
```
